title: Why did I lose more than I gained?
body:
Win = 17lp
Lose = 20lp

It doesn't make any sense...
PS: I'm g1 not any high tier.

replies.body: Since some have answered your question, to fix this either you go solo q for a number of games or you take a break by not playing ranked for a few weeks

Are you duoing at all? If so, that skews your ranked gains.

That or you went on a loss streak recently. I remember when i inted like 18 games in a row and went from getting 25 LP per win and losing 11 to getting 16 and losing 21.
Your mmr is less than gold 1 average, itâ€™s not rocket science.
how do i check my mmr?

By looking at the rank+winrate of your teammates and opponents and making an educated guess. MMR is a hidden number with hidden calculation, largely to prevent people from abusing the calculations. 

Sites like op.gg can give you an estimated value, but they are based on op.gg's calculations and not Riot's, so they will never be completely accurate.

Basically, you can view MMR as your 'true' rank, and your visible rank as your measure of progression. MMR is designed to reflect your current skill as quickly as possible, which is why that value is used for matchmaking, and not your visible rank which is designed more as a goal to reach.

Basically, if by your, your team's, and your enemy's MMR you are expected to win that game and you win it, you will earn less LP than the average. If it's an even game, you will earn the average, and if you are expected to lose the game, you will earn more. The inverse is also true.

There are a few other factors that affect it, most of these 'other' category factors apply when you are in your initial climb or on a big win or loss streak, to prevent short-term results having long-term impacts, and level out once you reach your plateau.
